definition: a path (often marked) where something (as a street or railroad) can be crossed to get from one side to the other
details:
noun
- a path (often marked) where something (as a street or railroad) can be crossed to get from one side to the other
= synonyms: crossing
- the appropriation of a new style (especially in popular music) by combining elements of different genres in order to appeal to a wider audience
= example: the appropriation of a new style (especially in popular music) by combining elements of different genres in order to appeal to a wider audience
- a voter who is registered as a member of one political party but who votes in the primary of another party
= synonyms: crossover voter
- the interchange of sections between pairing homologous chromosomes during the prophase of meiosis
= synonyms: crossing over
